bibl.title: William Warden v. O. D. Butterfield. Petitioner Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, Holding terms at Seattle.
In the matter of the Application of William Warden for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Territory of Washington,) County of King. ) ss.

William Warden, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says: That he is the petitioner in the foregoing entitled matter, and has a just and legal ground for the issuance of said writ of Habeas Corpus, that he is poor and not able to pay the expenses thereof; he has that I have no property, real or personal, or any means whatever to pay the costs of the issuance of the Writ issued herein. William Warden Subscribed and sworn to before me, this 25th day of May, A. D. 1889. R. M. Hopkins Clerk of the above entitled District Court.

6858 Writ Warden Habeas Corpus
May 25 RM Hopkins
